verb.description: (of a person or animal) make a series of low, feeble sounds expressive of fear, pain, or discontent.
examples: a child in a bed nearby began to whimper

noun.description: A low, feeble sound expressive of fear or pain.
examples: she gave a little whimper of protest

origin: Early 16th century: from dialect whimp to whimper, of imitative origin.
